name: Rainbow Bridge National Monument
description: Rainbow Bridge is one of the world's largest known natural bridges. The span has undoubtedly inspired people throughout time--from the neighboring Native American tribes who consider Rainbow Bridge sacred, to the thousands of visitors from around the world who visit it each year. Please visit Rainbow Bridge in a spirit that honors and respects the cultures to whom it is sacred.
shortDescription: Rainbow Bridge is one of the world's largest known natural bridges. The span has undoubtedly inspired people throughout time--from the neighboring Native American tribes who consider Rainbow Bridge sa...

address.line1: c/o Glen Canyon National Recreation Area

operatingHours.description: Rainbow Bridge National Monument is open every day of the year, from sunrise to sunset. On rare occasions, the park may be closed for visitor safety while significant trail and/or dock repairs are taking place. Contact the park for up-to-date information on any closures in effect. Overnight camping or docking your boat is prohibited.

climate.weatherDescription: Summers are extremely hot with little, if any, shade. Winters are moderately cold with night time lows often below freezing. Spring weather is highly variable with extended periods of strong winds. Fall is generally mild. Temperatures range from 110째F (43째C) in June & July to 20째F (-7째C) in December & January. Although precipitation is generally less than 6 inches (15cm) annually, both heavy rains and flash flooding can occur, particularly during the summer monsoon season.

images.title: Rainbow Bridge
images.altText: A large sandstone arch - a natural bridge.
images.caption: Stand here and take in the majesty of Rainbow Bridge - the largest natural bridge in the National Park Service.

images.title: Aerial View of Rainbow Bridge
images.altText: A view of Rainbow Bridge from the air.
images.caption: Seen from the air, Rainbow Bridge is a graceful curve over the dry stream bed.

images.title: A Crowd Views Rainbow Bridge From Its Shadow
images.altText: A large crowd faces away from the camera at the scenery.
images.caption: In the desert heat after the rough walk up to Rainbow Bridge from the docks, you take shade where you can get it.

images.title: Rainbow Bridge Docks
images.altText: Boats and personal watercraft sidle up to docks.
images.caption: The only way to access Rainbow Bridge is by a two-day hike across the Navajo Nation, or a fifty-mile boat trip up Lake Powell.

images.title: Jim Mike Returns to Rainbow Bridge
images.altText: An elderly Native American man sits in a lawn chair under Rainbow Bridge
images.caption: In 1974, Ute Mountain Ute Jim Mike, one of the  guides who led the original expedition to Rainbow Bridge, returned to see how he had led the way for many more visitors.

images.title: Park Ranger at Second Observation Area
images.altText: Park Ranger standing in front of perfectly curved sandstone arch
images.caption: During the summer season, Park Rangers will be at the observation areas to answer your questions.
